intro: Ligusticopsis pteridophylla, commonly known as the broad-leaved ligustic, is a flowering plant belonging to the Apiaceae family. It is characterized by its compound leaves that are divided into broad, flat lobes, giving it a distinctive appearance. The plant produces small, yellowish flowers arranged in umbels, typical of the carrot family. It is native to parts of Europe and Asia and thrives in moist, temperate environments. Ligusticopsis pteridophylla is often found in meadows and along stream banks, where it contributes to the local biodiversity.
